Song.title: On this Day Earth Shall Ring (Personet Hodie)
Song.copyright: Author Unknown. Medieval Christmas hymn; from Pi√¶ Cantiones 1582; trans. Jane M. Joseph (1894-1929)

Arrangement.text:
Latin 1: Personent hodie Voces puerulae, Laudantes iocunde Qui nobis est natus, Summo Deo datus,
Refrain: Id-e-o-o-o, id-e-o-o-o, (I sing out, I sing out) Id-e-o gloria in excelsis Deo! (I sing out, glory to God in the highest)
Verse 1: On this day earth shall ring With the song children sing To the Lord, Christ our King, Born on earth to save us; Him the Father gave us.
Refrain: Id-e-o-o-o, id-e-o-o-o, (I sing out, I sing out) Id-e-o gloria in excelsis Deo! (I sing out, glory to God in the highest)
Verse 2: On this day angels sing; with their song earth shall ring, praising Christ, heaven's King, born on earth to save us; peace and love he gave us.
(15th Century)
Arrangement.searchtext: latin 1 personent hodie voces puerulae laudantes iocunde qui nobis est natus summo deo datus refrain ideooo ideooo i sing out i sing out ideo gloria in excelsis deo i sing out glory to god in the highest verse 1 on this day earth shall ring with the song children sing to the lord christ our king born on earth to save us him the father gave us refrain ideooo ideooo i sing out i sing out ideo gloria in excelsis deo i sing out glory to god in the highest verse 2 on this day angels sing with their song earth shall ring praising christ heavens king born on earth to save us peace and love he gave us 15th century
